command.name: acl
command.help: Show an ACL or ACL rule

argument.name: !<acls>
argument.help: ACL numbers

argument.name: !<cr>
argument.help: Show all rules in the specified ACLs

argument.name: !<rules>
argument.help: Rule numbers

argument.name: !<cr>
argument.help: Show the specified rules

argument.name: !<ports>
argument.help: Port numbers

argument.name: !<cr>
argument.help: Show the specified counter

argument.name: !<port-sets>
argument.help: Port-set numbers

argument.name: !<cr>
argument.help: Show port-set

argument.name: !<acls>
argument.help: ACL numbers

argument.name: !<rules>
argument.help: Rule numbers

argument.name: info
argument.help: Show the policer info

argument.name: !<cr>
argument.help: Show the specified counters with policer info

argument.name: !<cr>
argument.help: Show the specified counters

command.name: del
command.help: Delete MAC address, VLANs, LAGs, or ports from VLANs, or counters from VLANs or LAGs

argument.name: !<acls>
argument.help: ACL numbers to delete

argument.name: !<cr>
argument.help: Delete the specified ACLs

argument.name: !<acls>
argument.help: ACL numbers containing the rules to delete

argument.name: !<rules>
argument.help: The rule numbers to delete

argument.name: !<cr>
argument.help: Delete the rules with the specified numbers

argument.name: !<port set>
argument.help: The port-set to delete

argument.name: !<cr>
argument.help: Delete an ACL port-set

argument.name: !<ports>
argument.help: Logical port numbers to dissociate from ACLs

argument.name: !<acls>
argument.help: ACL numbers

argument.name: !<cr>
argument.help: dissociate ACLs from ports

argument.name: !<ports>
argument.help: Logical port numbers to dissociate from port-set

argument.name: !<port-sets>
argument.help: Port-set numbers

argument.name: !<cr>
argument.help: Dissociate ports from port-set

command.name: create
command.help: Create VLANs, LAGs, multicast groups, ACLs, etc.

argument.name: !<acls>
argument.help: ACL numbers to create

argument.name: !<cr>
argument.help: Create the specified ACLs

argument.name: !<frametypes>
argument.help: Frame types to support (any, ipv4, ipv6, non-ip).

argument.name: !<routingtypes>
argument.help: Routing types to support (any, switched, unicast, multicast, any-glort, switched-glort, ucast-glort, mcast-glort)

argument.name: !<cr>
argument.help: Create ACLs with the specified scenarios

argument.name: tunnel
argument.help: Select tunneling types

argument.name: !<tunneltypes>
argument.help: Tunneling types to support (any, trill-unicast, trill-multicast, vn-tunnel)

argument.name: !<cr>
argument.help: Create ACLs with the specified scenarios

argument.name: !<precedence>
argument.help: Precedence to assign to ACL

argument.name: !<cr>
argument.help: Create ACLs with the specified precedence

argument.name: !<precedence>
argument.help: Precedence to assign to ACL

argument.name: !<cr>
argument.help: Create ACLs with the specified precedence

command.name: acl-rule
command.help: Create a rule in an ACL

argument.name: !<acls>
argument.help: ACL numbers to create the new rule in

argument.name: !<rules>
argument.help: Rule numbers to create

argument.name: !<cr>
argument.help: Create rules with the specified numbers

argument.name: !<cr>
argument.help: Create an ACL port-set

argument.name: !<cr>
argument.help: Compile and apply ACLs

argument.name: !<options>
argument.help: Compiler options (e.g. quiet,nondisruptive,tryalloc 15:23)

argument.name: !<cr>
argument.help: Compile and apply ACLs

command.name: add
command.help: Add mac addresses to MA table, or ports to VLANs or LAGs

command.name: acl-rule
command.help: Add a condition or action to an ACL rule

argument.name: condition
argument.help: Add a condition to an ACL rule

argument.name: !<acls>
argument.help: ACL numbers

argument.name: !<rules>
argument.help: rule numbers

argument.name: dip
argument.help: Destination IP address

argument.name: !<dstIp>
argument.help: IP address and optional mask (e.g., 2001:db8::/32)

argument.name: !<cr>
argument.help: add the dip condition to the specified rule

argument.name: dmac
argument.help: Destination MAC address

argument.name: !<dst>
argument.help: MAC address and optional mask (e.g. 00:15:ed:00:00:00/ff:ff:ff:00:00:00)

argument.name: !<cr>
argument.help: add the dmac condition to the specified rule

argument.name: ethtype
argument.help: EtherType

argument.name: !<ethType>
argument.help: EtherType and optional mask (e.g. 0x0800/0xff00)

argument.name: !<cr>
argument.help: add the ethtype condition to the specified rule

argument.name: flags
argument.help: Misc flags for fragmentation and IP options

argument.name: !<flags>
argument.help: flags value and optional mask (e.g. 1/3)

argument.name: !<cr>
argument.help: add the flags condition to the specified rule

argument.name: flow
argument.help: Flow Label (IPv6 only)

argument.name: !<flow>
argument.help: Flow Label and optional mask (e.g. 0x12340/0xffff0)

argument.name: !<cr>
argument.help: add the flow condition to the specified rule

argument.name: ftype
argument.help: Match ISL frame type

argument.name: !<ftype>
argument.help: ISL Frame Type: 0-normal, 1-routed, 2-special

argument.name: !<cr>
argument.help: add ISL frame type match to the specified rule

argument.name: ingress-port
argument.help: Ingress ports on which this rule is valid

argument.name: !<port list>
argument.help: List of ingress ports

argument.name: !<cr>
argument.help: add the ports to the specified rule

argument.name: ip-length
argument.help: Match IP length

argument.name: !<ip-length>
argument.help: Length of IP packet with optional mask (0x0094/0xFFFF)

argument.name: !<cr>
argument.help: add ip-length match to the specified rule

argument.name: isl-user
argument.help: Match ISL User

argument.name: !<isl-user>
argument.help: ISL User with optional mask (e.g. 0x14/0x1F)

argument.name: !<cr>
argument.help: add ISL User field match to the specified rule

argument.name: l4-deep-inspection
argument.help: 64 bits of deep packet inspection

argument.name: !<L4DeepInspection>
argument.help: deep inspection value and optional mask (e.g. 0xabcdef1234567890/0xfffffffffffffff0)

argument.name: !<cr>
argument.help: add the deep inspection condition to the specified rule

argument.name: l4-deep-inspection2
argument.help: 32 bytes of deep packet inspection

argument.name: !<Chunk ID>
argument.help: ID for the 8 byte Chunk. In an IP frame, where Chunk 0 would represent the 8 bytes starting at the 5th byte of the payload being sent. Bit 63 of the chunk is sent first. Note that the first four bytes can be inspected using l4-src-port and l4-dst-port. If IPv6 is used, only chunk 0 can be defined

argument.name: !<L4DeepInspection2>
argument.help: Layer 4 deep inspection value and optional mask in a 8 byte chunk (e.g. 0xabcdef1234567890/0xffffffffffffffff)

argument.name: !<cr>
argument.help: add the deep inspection condition to the specified rule

argument.name: l4-dst-port
argument.help: TCP/UDP destination port

argument.name: !<port>
argument.help: TCP/UDP port number with optional mask(e.g. 0x1F90/0xFFFF)

argument.name: !<cr>
argument.help: add the l4-dst-port condition to the specified rule

argument.name: l4-src-port
argument.help: TCP/UDP source port

argument.name: !<port>
argument.help: TCP/UDP port number with optional mask(e.g. 0x1F90/0xFFFF)

argument.name: !<cr>
argument.help: add the l4-src-port condition to the specified rule

argument.name: non-ip-payload
argument.help: Layer 3 deep inspection

argument.name: !<Chunk ID>
argument.help: ID for the 8 byte Chunk. In an Ethernet frame, where Chunk 0 would represent the first 8 bytes of the payload being sent. Bit 63 of the chunk is sent first.

argument.name: !<L3DeepInspection>
argument.help: Layer 3 deep inspection value and optional mask in a 8 byte chunk (e.g. 0xabcdef1234567890/0xffffffffffffffff)

argument.name: !<cr>
argument.help: add the deep inspection condition to the specified rule

argument.name: port-set
argument.help: Ingress port-set on which this rule is valid

argument.name: !<portSet>
argument.help: Port-set

argument.name: !<cr>
argument.help: add the port-set to the specified rule

argument.name: priority
argument.help: VLAN priority

argument.name: !<vlanPri>
argument.help: VLAN priority and optional mask (e.g. 2/3)

argument.name: !<cr>
argument.help: add the priority condition to the specified rule

argument.name: priority2
argument.help: VLAN2 priority

argument.name: !<vlanPri>
argument.help: VLAN2 priority and optional mask (e.g. 2/3)

argument.name: !<cr>
argument.help: add the priority2 condition to the specified rule

argument.name: protocol
argument.help: IPv4 Protocol or IPv6 Next Header

argument.name: !<protocol>
argument.help: protocol value and optional mask (e.g. 59/127)

argument.name: !<cr>
argument.help: add the protocol condition to the specified rule

argument.name: sip
argument.help: Source IP address

argument.name: !<srcIp>
argument.help: IP address and optional mask (e.g. 192.0.2.0/24)

argument.name: !<cr>
argument.help: add the sip condition to the specified rule

argument.name: smac
argument.help: Source MAC address

argument.name: !<src>
argument.help: MAC address and optional mask (e.g. 00:15:ed:00:00:00/ff:ff:ff:00:00:00)

argument.name: !<cr>
argument.help: add the smac condition to the specified rule

argument.name: switch-priority
argument.help: switch priority

argument.name: !<switchPri>
argument.help: switch priority and optional mask (e.g. 6/14)

argument.name: !<cr>
argument.help: add the switch-priority condition to the specified rule

argument.name: tcp-flags
argument.help: TCP flags

argument.name: !<tcpFlags>
argument.help: TCP flags and optional mask (e.g. 5/15)

argument.name: !<cr>
argument.help: add the tcp-flags condition to the specified rule

argument.name: l4-entry
argument.help: L4 Entry

argument.name: !<entry>
argument.help: L4 Entry data and optional mask (e.g. 5/15)

argument.name: !<cr>
argument.help: add the l4-entry condition to the specified rule

argument.name: traffic
argument.help: Differentiated Services Code Point

argument.name: !<dscp>
argument.help: DSCP value and optional mask (e.g. 0x3/0xf)

argument.name: !<cr>
argument.help: add the traffic condition to the specified rule

argument.name: tos
argument.help: Type of Service octet

argument.name: !<tos>
argument.help: TOS value and optional mask (e.g. 0x3/0xf)

argument.name: !<cr>
argument.help: add the traffic condition to the specified rule

argument.name: ttl
argument.help: IPv4 Time to Live or IPv6 Hop Limit

argument.name: !<ttl>
argument.help: Time to Live value and optional mask (e.g. 0/0xf0)

argument.name: !<cr>
argument.help: add the ttl condition to the specified rule

argument.name: vlan
argument.help: VLAN ID

argument.name: !<vlanId>
argument.help: VLAN ID and optional mask (e.g. 0x120/0xff0)

argument.name: !<cr>
argument.help: add the vlan condition to the specified rule

argument.name: vlan2
argument.help: VLAN2 ID

argument.name: !<vlanId>
argument.help: VLAN2 ID and optional mask (e.g. 0x120/0xff0)

argument.name: !<cr>
argument.help: add the vlan2 condition to the specified rule

argument.name: vlan-tag
argument.help: VLAN Tag Type

argument.name: !<vlanTag>
argument.help: VLAN Tag Type (none, standard, typeA, typeB, vlan1, vlan2, vlan1Only, vlan2Only, vlan1_vlan2)

argument.name: !<cr>
argument.help: add the vlan tag condition to the specified rule

argument.name: src-glort
argument.help: Source GLORT

argument.name: !<srcGlort>
argument.help: Source GLORT and optional mask (e.g. 0x1200/0xff00)

argument.name: !<cr>
argument.help: add the source glort condition to the specified rule

argument.name: dst-glort
argument.help: Destination GLORT

argument.name: !<dstGlort>
argument.help: Destination GLORT and optional mask (e.g. 0x1200/0xff00)

argument.name: !<cr>
argument.help: add the destination glort condition to the specified rule

argument.name: frag-type
argument.help: Fragment Frame Type

argument.name: !<fragType>
argument.help: Fragment Type (complete, headFrag, subFrag, completeOrFrag)

argument.name: !<cr>
argument.help: add the fragment type condition to the specified rule

argument.name: frame-type
argument.help: Frame Type

argument.name: !<frameType>
argument.help: Frame Type (nonIp, ipv4, ipv6)

argument.name: !<cr>
argument.help: add the frame type condition to the specified rule

argument.name: map-src
argument.help: Mapped Source Port

argument.name: !<srcMap>
argument.help: Mapped Source Port and optional mask (e.g. 0x2/0xf)

argument.name: !<cr>
argument.help: add the mapped source port condition to the specified rule

argument.name: map-protocol
argument.help: Mapped Protocol

argument.name: !<protocolMap>
argument.help: Mapped Protocol and optional mask (e.g. 0x2/0xf)

argument.name: !<cr>
argument.help: add the mapped protocol condition to the specified rule

argument.name: map-l4-src
argument.help: Mapped L4 Source Port

argument.name: !<l4SrcMap>
argument.help: Mapped L4 Source Port and optional mask (e.g. 0x2/0xf)

argument.name: !<cr>
argument.help: add the mapped L4 source port condition to the specified rule

argument.name: map-l4-dst
argument.help: Mapped L4 Destination Port

argument.name: !<l4DstMap>
argument.help: Mapped L4 Destination Port and optional mask (e.g. 0x2/0xf)

argument.name: !<cr>
argument.help: add the mapped L4 destination port condition to the specified rule

argument.name: map-smac
argument.help: Mapped Source MAC Address

argument.name: !<smacMap>
argument.help: Mapped Source MAC Address and optional mask (e.g. 0x2/0xf)

argument.name: !<cr>
argument.help: add the mapped source MAC condition to the specified rule

argument.name: map-dmac
argument.help: Mapped Destination MAC Address

argument.name: !<dmacMap>
argument.help: Mapped Destination MAC Address and optional mask (e.g. 0x2/0xf)

argument.name: !<cr>
argument.help: add the mapped destination MAC condition to the specified rule

argument.name: map-ethtype
argument.help: Mapped Ethernet Type value

argument.name: !<ethTypeMap>
argument.help: Mapped Ethernet Type Value and optional mask (e.g. 0x2/0xf)

argument.name: !<cr>
argument.help: add the mapped ethertype condition to the specified rule

argument.name: map-ip-length
argument.help: Mapped IP Length

argument.name: !<ipLengthMap>
argument.help: Mapped IP Length Value and optional mask (e.g. 0x2/0xf)

argument.name: !<cr>
argument.help: add the mapped IP length condition to the specified rule

argument.name: map-sip
argument.help: Mapped Source IP Address

argument.name: !<sipMap>
argument.help: Mapped Source IP Address and optional mask (e.g. 0x2/0xf)

argument.name: !<cr>
argument.help: add the mapped sip condition to the specified rule

argument.name: map-dip
argument.help: Mapped Destination IP Address

argument.name: !<dipMap>
argument.help: Mapped Destination IP Address and optional mask (e.g. 0x2/0xf)

argument.name: !<cr>
argument.help: add the mapped dip condition to the specified rule

argument.name: map-vlan
argument.help: Mapped VLAN ID

argument.name: !<vlanId>
argument.help: Mapped vlanId and optional mask (e.g. 0x2/0xf)

argument.name: !<cr>
argument.help: add the mapped vlan condition to the specified rule

argument.name: trill-smac
argument.help: TRILL Source MAC address (Outer MAC)

argument.name: !<trill-smac>
argument.help: MAC address and optional mask (e.g. 00:15:ed:00:00:00/ff:ff:ff:00:00:00)

argument.name: !<cr>
argument.help: add the trill-smac condition to the specified rule

argument.name: trill-type
argument.help: TRILL encapsulated frame

argument.name: !<trillType>
argument.help: TRILL Type (any, ucast, mcast)

argument.name: !<cr>
argument.help: add the trill-type condition to the specified rule

argument.name: trill-srb
argument.help: TRILL Source RBridge Nickname

argument.name: !<trill-srb>
argument.help: TRILL Src RBridge Nickname and optional mask (e.g. 0x1234/0xffff)

argument.name: !<cr>
argument.help: add the trill-srb condition to the specified rule

argument.name: trill-rrb
argument.help: TRILL Remote RBridge Nickname

argument.name: !<trill-rrb>
argument.help: TRILL Remote RBridge Nickname and optional mask (e.g. 0x1234/0xffff)

argument.name: !<cr>
argument.help: add the trill-rrb condition to the specified rule

argument.name: action
argument.help: Add an action to an ACL rule

argument.name: !<acls>
argument.help: ACL numbers

argument.name: !<rules>
argument.help: rule numbers

argument.name: count
argument.help: Count frames and octets

argument.name: !<cr>
argument.help: add the count action to the specified rule

argument.name: count-notify
argument.help: Count frames and octets, and send interrupt to CPU

argument.name: !<cr>
argument.help: add the count-notify action to the specified rule

argument.name: deny
argument.help: Drop the frame

argument.name: !<cr>
argument.help: add the deny action to the specified rule

argument.name: dscp
argument.help: Change the Differentiated Services Code Point

argument.name: !<dscp>
argument.help: New DSCP value

argument.name: !<cr>
argument.help: add the dscp action to the specified rule

argument.name: log
argument.help: Copy the frame to the CPU

argument.name: !<cr>
argument.help: add the log action to the specified rule

argument.name: mirror
argument.help: Copy the frame to the specified port

argument.name: !<mirrorPort>
argument.help: Logical port to mirror to

argument.name: !<cr>
argument.help: add the mirror action to the specified rule

argument.name: permit
argument.help: Prevent the frame from being dropped

argument.name: !<cr>
argument.help: add the permit action to the specified rule

argument.name: police
argument.help: Apply a policer to the frame

argument.name: !<policer>
argument.help: policer number

argument.name: !<cr>
argument.help: add the police action to the specified rule

argument.name: switch-priority
argument.help: Change the switch priority

argument.name: !<switchPriority>
argument.help: new switch priority

argument.name: !<cr>
argument.help: add the switch-priority action to the specified rule

argument.name: trap
argument.help: Send the frame to the CPU instead of normal destination

argument.name: !<cr>
argument.help: add the trap action to the specified rule

argument.name: trap-always
argument.help: Send the frame to the CPU instead of normal destination regardless of STP state

argument.name: !<cr>
argument.help: add the trap-always action to the specified rule

argument.name: user
argument.help: Change the user bits in the F64 tag

argument.name: !<user>
argument.help: New user bits and optional mask (e.g. 0b10110000/0b11110000)

argument.name: !<cr>
argument.help: add the user action to the specified rule

argument.name: vlan
argument.help: Change the VLAN ID

argument.name: !<vlan>
argument.help: new VLAN ID

argument.name: !<cr>
argument.help: add the vlan action to the specified rule

argument.name: vlan-priority
argument.help: Change the VLAN priority

argument.name: !<vlanPriority>
argument.help: new VLAN priority

argument.name: !<cr>
argument.help: add the vlan-priority action to the specified rule

argument.name: redirect
argument.help: Redirect the frame to the specified port

argument.name: !<logicalPort>
argument.help: Logical port to redirect to

argument.name: !<cr>
argument.help: add the redirect action to the specified rule

argument.name: flood-dest
argument.help: Redirect frame to a specified port on a MAC lookup miss

argument.name: !<port>
argument.help: Destination logical port to redirect to

argument.name: !<cr>
argument.help: Add the flood-dest action to the specified rule

argument.name: l3-hash-prof
argument.help: Set the L3 hashing profile (for use only on pre-remap stage ACLs)

argument.name: !<profile>
argument.help: Hashing profile index number

argument.name: !<cr>
argument.help: Add the l3-hash-prof action to the specified rule

argument.name: noroute
argument.help: Ignore the route action

argument.name: !<cr>
argument.help: add the noroute action to the specified rule

argument.name: lbg
argument.help: Redirect the frame to the specified lbg

argument.name: !<lbgNumber>
argument.help: Load Balancing Group logical port to redirect to

argument.name: !<cr>
argument.help: add the lbg action to the specified rule

argument.name: route
argument.help: Route the frame to the specified ECMP Group

argument.name: !<groupId>
argument.help: ECMP Group Id to route on

argument.name: !<cr>
argument.help: add the route action to the specified rule

argument.name: vlan2
argument.help: Change the VLAN2 ID

argument.name: !<vlan>
argument.help: new VLAN2 ID

argument.name: !<cr>
argument.help: add the vlan2 action to the specified rule

argument.name: vlan2-priority
argument.help: Change the VLAN2 priority

argument.name: !<vlanPriority>
argument.help: new VLAN2 priority

argument.name: !<cr>
argument.help: add the vlan2-priority action to the specified rule

argument.name: mirror-grp
argument.help: Copy the frame to the specified mirror group(s)

argument.name: !<mask>
argument.help: Bit mask of mirror group numbers (e.g., 0xA for mirror groups 1 and 3)

argument.name: !<cr>
argument.help: add the mirror-grp action to the specified rule

argument.name: srcGlort
argument.help: Change the Source GLORT

argument.name: !<Glort>
argument.help: new Source GLORT

argument.name: !<cr>
argument.help: add the Source GLORT action to the specified rule

argument.name: tunnelId
argument.help: Assign an Ingress Tunnel ID

argument.name: !<tunnelId>
argument.help: Ingress Tunnel ID

argument.name: !<cr>
argument.help: add the Tunnel ID action to the specified rule

argument.name: tunnelIdSrc
argument.help: Assign an Ingress Tunnel ID and Source GLORT

argument.name: !<tunnelId>
argument.help: Ingress Tunnel ID

argument.name: !<Glort>
argument.help: new Source GLORT

argument.name: !<cr>
argument.help: add the Tunnel ID and Source GLORT action to the specified rule

argument.name: distTree
argument.help: Assign a TRILL Distribution Tree value

argument.name: !<distTree>
argument.help: TRILL Distribution Tree value

argument.name: !<cr>
argument.help: add the TRILL Distribution Tree action to the specified rule

argument.name: precedence
argument.help: Assign a rule precedence value

argument.name: !<precedence>
argument.help: Rule Precedence value

argument.name: !<cr>
argument.help: add the rule precedence action to the specified rule

argument.name: vn-tunnel
argument.help: Change the virtual-network tunnel ID

argument.name: !<vn-tunnel>
argument.help: new VN Tunnel ID

argument.name: !<cr>
argument.help: add the vn-tunnel action to the specified rule

command.name: port
command.help: Associate an ACL with a port

argument.name: !<ports>
argument.help: Logical port numbers to associate with ACLs

argument.name: !<acls>
argument.help: ACL numbers

argument.name: ingress
argument.help: associate ACLs with ports on ingress

argument.name: !<cr>
argument.help: associate ACLs with ports on ingress

argument.name: egress
argument.help: associate ACLs with ports on egress

argument.name: !<cr>
argument.help: associate ACLs with ports on egress

argument.name: !<ports>
argument.help: Logical port numbers to associate with port-set

argument.name: !<port-sets>
argument.help: Port-set numbers

argument.name: !<acl>
argument.help: An ACL number

argument.name: !<oldRule>
argument.help: The old rule number

argument.name: !<newRule>
argument.help: The new rule number

argument.name: !<cr>
argument.help: Renumber the specified acl rule

command.name: reset
command.help: Reset switch, port, vlan, mac, lag properties

argument.name: !<ports>
argument.help: Port numbesr

argument.name: !<cr>
argument.help: Reset the specified acl counters

argument.name: !<acls>
argument.help: ACL numbers

argument.name: !<rules>
argument.help: Rule numbers

argument.name: !<cr>
argument.help: Reset the specified acl counter

command.name: acl-rule
command.help: Remove all conditions or actions from an ACL rule

argument.name: condition
argument.help: Remove all conditions from an ACL rule

argument.name: !<acls>
argument.help: ACL numbers

argument.name: !<rules>
argument.help: rule numbers

argument.name: !<cr>
argument.help: remove all conditions from the specified rules

argument.name: action
argument.help: Remove all actions from an ACL rule

argument.name: !<acls>
argument.help: ACL numbers

argument.name: !<rules>
argument.help: rule numbers

argument.name: !<cr>
argument.help: remove all actions from the specified rules

argument.name: !<acls>
argument.help: ACL numbers

argument.name: table
argument.help: Indicates which FFU or BST table to use

argument.name: best-fit
argument.help: Use the next table ressource available (default)

argument.name: !<cr>
argument.help: Use the next table ressource available (default)

argument.name: table0
argument.help: Use the FFU table located after the remap stage

argument.name: !<cr>
